main event: A UFO sighting occurred on 27 April 1955 in Bryn Mawr, Pennsylvania, witnessed by a civilian who described a bright light varying in color and shape, appearing as a single stationary light or multiple rapidly moving objects. The object was estimated to be between the size of a basketball and a baseball, hovering in the sky and displaying flashing and color-changing characteristics.
interesting points: The object was initially described as brilliant in coloring and shape, transforming from round to cigar shape to boomerang shape, and ending as a distant star flashing white, red, and green.
The witness estimated the object to be approximately 500 yards away and noticed no sound coming from it.
The witness made a sketch of the object he observed and reported the sighting to the local police, who investigated but could not determine what the object was.
Weather observations indicated unlimited visibility, no thunderstorms, and no unusual meteorological conditions during the UFO sighting.
The conclusion of the investigation suggested that the object may have been a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical in nature, specifically pointing out that Jupiter was in the reported position.
result: possibility of the object being a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical in nature with specific reference to Jupiter's position
sighted object: bright light varying in color and shape, appearing as a single stationary light or multiple rapidly moving objects
